result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J. Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random testing.
Defendant shall have AODA and comply with recommendations.
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall report on or before 6 pm on July 1, 2022.
Huber granted.
Defendant shall complete 25 hours community service during term of probation.
Ignition interlock to be monitored through DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J. Jacobson

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey J. Jacobson in court.  Attorney Matthew C. Allen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jeffrey J. Jacobson. Resolution reached. Charge to be amended to misdemeanor 346.62(3). Victim does not appear. Attorney Allen attempts to contact victim. State recommends 12 months probation, absolute sobriety, random testing, AODA, 60 days jail with huber (State opposes electronic monitoring), 25 hours community service, IID as monitored by DOC, $831 fine and costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. No contest plea entered to amended charge. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of amended charge. Court takes short recess for Attorney Allen to contact victim again. She wanted to be involved. Court recalls case at 9:00. Victim appears by video. Attorney Allen heard on recommendation. Blood draw was done without probable cause. OWI was not charged but result was .142. Attorney Kieler heard on joint recommendation and requests report date of July 1, 2022 for completion of program. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders probation 1 year with conditions: 60 days jail with huber (report by 6 pm on 7-1-22), absolute sobriety, random testing, AODA and comply, counseling, 25 hours community service, 12 month IID to be monitored by DOC, $831 fine and costs to Clerk of Courts, DNA.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey J. Jacobson in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jeffrey J. Jacobson. Attorney Matthew Allen appeared by video for prosecution. Victim appeared by video. Waiver filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey J. Jacobson appeared in court, Attorney Ryan Kieler for Jeffrey J. Jacobson appeared in court, Attorney Matthew C. Allen for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. Victim appeared by zoom. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Allen requests $5000 signature bond with absolute sobriety and not to operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Court orders $1000 signature bond, not to possess or consume any intoxicants, not to drive motor vehicle without valid license. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing set.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicant during the pendency of this case. 
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid license.
